page.title: 02LAWRENCE WESTON - THE PAST
page.content: Lawrence Weston took its name from a leper hosiptal that used to own lands in this area. The hospital was called St. Lawrence of Bristol. The earliest evidence of human occupation in the area is the remains of 2 Iron Age {Hill Forts}in the grounds of{Blaise {Castle Estate}and on Kingsweston Ridge. Further evidence of early occupation was discovered when the area was being cleared for the building of the estate in the 1940's. The walls of a large{Roman Villa}were uncovered and these may still be seen today. Probably the most spectacular historical building in the area is {Kingsweston House}designed by John Vanbrugh. For a hundred years after 1833 the house was owned by the Miles family. Today it is the headquarters of the training branch of the{Avon and {Somerset Constabulary.}L. W. School
